style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: C.H. Evans Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Evans family was in the commercial brewing business for three generations. The original brewery was built in Hudson, NY in 1786. It continued production until prohibition in 1920. Its award winning ales were well known in the Northeast and were even exported to England and France. Production levels peaked in 1915 when 65,000 barrels of beer were produced at the Hudson Facility.

The brewery bottled its own beer in Hudson at one of the country’s earliest bottling facilities (1889) and later at a plant in New York City. The family also malted much of their own grain in their malt houses at the Hudson facility. Neil Evans revives this rich heritage here at the Albany Pump Station. Surviving C.H. Evans Brewing Company memorabilia is displayed in the new facility, as well as pictures of the pump station as it appeared at the turn of the century.

breweries.name: Rhinegeist
breweries.description:
Rhinegeist is a brewery out of Cincinnati, OH that was built within the skeleton of the old Moerlein bottling plant (built in 1895). Within these unique and historic walls, we brew 20bbl batches of beer that sings with flavor and delights us. The yin/yang of our brewing philosophy is hoppy/sessionable and we aim to brew beers where “the first sip calls for the third”.  We’re a small team with big dreams and tend to smile while we sweat. We brew those styles which are most compelling to our thirst and we certainly hope you enjoy our brews as much as we do.

Rhinegeist means “ghost of the Rhine”, and refers to our place here in the historic Brewery District in the Over the Rhine neighborhood of Cincinnati. At the turn of the century, this neighborhood was home to nearly 45,o00 inhabitants, most of them of German descent and 38 breweries. We hope to engender the spirit of camaraderie and hard work that we imagine those living and brewing in this neighborhood at that time embodied.

We self distribute our beer, which means each beer that you drink in a bar or restaurant is poured from a keg that we delivered cold in our refrigerated van (keep your eyes peeled for it around town). We like to keep beer as fresh as possible, which means that every keg we fill is immediately moved into cold storage where it sits until we load it onto our refrigerated van for delivery to the coldbox of each local account. Fresh beer is tasty beer, and that’s our favorite kind.

data.name: Puppet Show Pale
data.description: A classic American-style pale ale, Flat12 Puppet Show Pale has a beautiful, copper color and a big aroma from generous additions of hops. This beer is assertive, but not overbearing despite being hopped at the top end of the style. Enjoy a Puppet Show, or whatever you are doing, but keep one hand free to hold your glass.

breweries.name: Flat12 Bierwerks
breweries.description:
Flat12 Bierwerks is a production craft brewery based in downtown Indianapolis, USA. Flat12 brews beers for quality, consistency and tradition - with a twist. Our classic line-up includes the Upside Down Blonde, Half Cycle IPA, Pogue's Run Porter and Flat12 Amber Ale. Specialties and seasonals will feature herbs, spices and other experimentations, always geared toward flavor, taste and well-orchestrated subtlety. 

Inspiration: The Flathead 12-cylinder engine - a nod to the automotive and craft brewing heritage of our neighborhood and the early 1900s era when both thrived.

data.name: Purist Pale Ale
data.description:
Our light copper pale ale has a delicate malt attribute balanced by an aggressive hop flavor and aroma. Many American micros have developed their own version of this classic English style beer. Our brewers anticipate that you will enjoy their variation. 
Hikers on the Appalachian Trail are considered \purist hikers"if they cover every inch of the trail during the hike. Our brewers refuse to compromise the quality of our products with the \""purist hiker\"" in mind."""

breweries.name: North by Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
breweries.description:
North by Northwest came into existence from an idea that I had many years ago – that great craft brewed beer and fabulous food could come together in a fun and interesting atmosphere.

I chose the name North by Northwest because I wanted to convey the image of the Northwest where many brew pubs and micro-breweries got their start. Once settling on the name,the architecture and the image flowed naturally. Stone and wood are combined with the high vaulted ceiling to create the feel of those great lodges in our Northwest National parks.We have urbanized it a bit with the steel structure and industrial designed light fixtures. The Brewery Tower is a prominent feature along with the NXNW grain silos. The one directly in front of the Brewery Tower is a functioning silo full of 25,000 lbs. of barley – the major component ofthe beer making process. All the beers at NXNW are brewed right on site inside the Tower.

data.name: Pyramid Rock Pale Ale
data.description: Going back to our recipes developed in the shadow of this Western NM monolith, this is nothing like your standard American Pale Ale. No American hops to be found in this gem. Lots of earthy, spicy Kent Goldings and premium English Crystal malts make this beer unique in a sea of ubiquity.

breweries.name: La Cumbre Brewing Company
breweries.description:
La Cumbre Brewing Co. is what happens when two people take one thing altogether way too seriously. Beer is what we do. It’s all we do.
 
The best beer money can make; the best beer money can buy. Simple as that.
 
Sure, we could tell you about the quality ingredients, the state of the art equipment, the commitment to traditional brewing methods… But all you really need to know is that our brewer is the pickiest SOB on earth, especially when it comes to the beer he drinks.
 
Well, this is the beer he drinks.
 
And we guarantee that you won’t find better beer anywhere.

We don’t use gluten-free filtering, gluten-free enzymes or any other gluten-free gimmicks. Instead we use only naturally gluten-free ingredients to create great tasting and unique craft beers.

breweries.name: Corcoran Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Corcoran Brewing Company was founded in 2011 on the beautiful foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Waterford Virginia. This was the second business venture for Corcoran whom had been making award winning wines since 2004. Corcoran which is family owned and operated decided in 2011 to branch out into the hand crafted beer industry. Initially started in a barn on old farmland near Corcoran Vineyards, this combination became Virginia’s first vineyard / brewery combo in the state. After several years of growing business it was realized that there was not enough room to stay as demand for the beer grew. In early 2014 the brewery was moved to Purcellville Virginia which is about 6 miles from where it started.

Corcoran Brewing Company has produced over thirty three distinct beers since opening day. We strive to create both traditional beer types as well as creating unique experiences with experimental beers. On any given day we have twelve beers on tap ranging from Kolch style, American Pale Ales, IPA’s, Imperial IPA’s, Stouts, Bourbon barrel aged, port barrel aged and more. This daily broad selection of quality hand-made craft beers has been a primary reason for our success. Customers can always find a beer that meets their drinking style.

data.name: Quantum Pale Ale
data.description:

A touch of caramel flavor and clean malt flavor balance the floral and earthy hop flavor and aroma which differenciates us from most of the citrusy NW Pales in the market. Balance is the key word again in this local favorite.

breweries.name: Ninkasi Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. 

Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.

breweries.name: Bloomington Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Philosophy—
Life without labor is guilt. 
Labor without art is brutality—John Rusgan

There is a nearly infinite variety of ways to make good beer. At the Bloomington Brewing Company, we make beers that we like to drink. That’s the first rule. Great ingredients and attention to detail is the second. Our intention is not to grow a large brewery operation, our intention is to make great beer that we like to drink and to take care of our community.

We make only ales and they are available only on draft in Bloomington, Indianapolis and the surrounding communities. We do not bottle our beers. We’re not against bottling, and we will assuredly reach a point in the future where we will package our beer, but no matter how good a beer is in the bottle, it can never be better than the beer coming from a well managed tap. Often it will be not nearly as good. Why? Draft beer is fresher; that’s a big one. Packaging beer is a complicated process with lots of potential for bad things to happen. Once packaged, the beer is exposed to its two mortal enemies; Sunlight and time.

Established in 2006 by Jamie Floyd and Nikos Ridge, Ninkasi Brewing Company continues to brew independent craft beer from its Pacific Northwest home base in Eugene, Oregon. Named after the Sumerian Goddess of fermentation, the brewery operates under the core purpose: Perpetuate Better Living. Known for beers like Total Domination IPA, Tricerahops Double IPA, Dawn of the Red IRA, and cult favorites like Sleigh'r and Maiden the Shade, Ninkasi proudly serves quality craft beers while focusing on community involvement, art and culture. 

Learn more at www.ninkasibrewing.com.

data.name: Radiant Ale
data.description:
Earthy and floral hops balance this Northwest-style pale ale, with a touch of Crystal and Vienna malts for flavor. Crisp and flavorful, Radiant Ale is a clean-finishing summer offering in the Ninkasi tradition. The smooth malt character is balanced by an elegant hop bitterness, the perfect complement to a glorious summer day. 

Awards:International-Style Pale Ale (Great American Beer Festival 2011) - Bronze

A touch of Crystal malt is used to sweeten-up this beer in addition to some Vienna malt for balance. The multiple hop varieties are grassy and earthy in tone and differentiate Radiant from most of the citrus forward Northwest Pale Ales!
data.foodPairings: Fish, Poultry, Tomato Sauces, Rustic Breads, Toffee, Cookies

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Upstream Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Derived from the Native American meaning of Omaha,  “upstream” or “against the current”, the Upstream Brewing  Company is just that—a restaurant different from the rest.

Since opening in 1996, the Upstream has been all about fresh—from the handcrafted beers to the locally grown produce to the lively atmosphere. Not to mention the friendly, knowledgeable staff. So stop in today, and find out why we’ve been named one of Omaha’s “Best” several years running.

data.name: Raindrop
data.description: Our flagship beer, brewed with Floor-malted premium U.K. Maris Otter pale malt, plus crystal and chocolate malts, to balance an international kettle hop bill of West Coast (Palisade - for bittering / flavor) and New Zealand Nelson Sauvin (flavor / aroma) hops, with an added hopback charge of whole U.K. Kent Golding hops to add a unique late hop finish. A true ‘hybrid’ Premium Pale Ale blending worldwide ingredients and brewing techniques for a nuanced, complex brew. The name was inspired by a New York Observer newspaper article describing Alex Hall as having "a face like a raindrop"!

breweries.name: Right Proper Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Right Proper Brewing Company will be a locally owned neighborhood brew pub in a Washington DC neighborhood

Washington, DC, needs at least two things: more affordable neighborhood restaurants, and at least one locally owned brewpub. 
Our objective is three-fold: We want to create a neighborhood gathering place that makes and serves well-priced delicious food and amazing fresh beer; we want to help our neighborhood thrive by investing in the community and its residents; and we want to anchor Washington, DC on the map as a destination for craft beer. Our business will invest in the growth and development of our employees as well as of our community.

We’ll take an innovative approach to small scale, “yeast-forward” craft brewing to produce artisanal ales and lagers in a comfortable, expertly designed casual old-world tavern. Serving fresh beer and affordable, high-quality American food, Right Proper will be a focus of pride for its neighborhood.

breweries.name: Ohana Brewing Co
breweries.description:
To handcraft innovative beers with unique and complex tastes; to make a positive impact in our community.  Ohana Brewing Company is an artisanal brewery in the heart of Los Angeles.

Our slogan is "A fresh face in beer!" Although our production is ultra-small we will pursue a number of strategies to stand out in the craft brewing industry. Our mission is to brew innovative beers with unique and complex tastes - not to just copy what the competition is doing. To that end we are committed to avoiding "repeatability" - i.e. we will not brew any beer more than once in our first full year of operation, i.e. no recipe will be duplicated.

We are a brewery, tasting room, and restaurant located in downtown Indianapolis. Our draft list is made up of our own beers, brewed under the direction of Head Brewer Bradley Zimmerman, and a constantly rotating cast of other delicious brews. data.name: Rangeland Pale Ale
data.description:
A well-rounded Pale Ale balanced with just the right amount of hops and malt. Medium Amber in colour, Cascade hops give citrus and floral aroma, while the malt gives notes of caramel and toffee. Rangeland Pale Ale crosses an ESB with an American pale ale to create a distinct Alberta craft brew.

2015 Silver Medal: UK Ales Category – Calgary Craft Beer Festival

breweries.name: Ribstone Creek Brewery
breweries.description:
What happens when a village administrator, a farmer, a lawyer, a mechanic, and a veteran brewmaster come together with a shared vision for locally brew craft beer? A state-of-the-art brewery materializes in the heart of a small rural Alberta community.

Ribstone Creek Brewery has been brewing premium craft beer since the Fall of 2012. Five founding members came together with a shared passion for locally made, high quality beer. They were also determined to keep local, in the very town they all grew up in. And so they purchased a former tractor dealership in an historical building on the main street of Edgerton, Alberta and set about renovating.

breweries.name: Rhinegeist
breweries.description:
Rhinegeist is a brewery out of Cincinnati, OH that was built within the skeleton of the old Moerlein bottling plant (built in 1895). Within these unique and historic walls, we brew 20bbl batches of beer that sings with flavor and delights us. The yin/yang of our brewing philosophy is hoppy/sessionable and we aim to brew beers where “the first sip calls for the third”.  We’re a small team with big dreams and tend to smile while we sweat. We brew those styles which are most compelling to our thirst and we certainly hope you enjoy our brews as much as we do.

Rhinegeist means “ghost of the Rhine”, and refers to our place here in the historic Brewery District in the Over the Rhine neighborhood of Cincinnati. At the turn of the century, this neighborhood was home to nearly 45,o00 inhabitants, most of them of German descent and 38 breweries. We hope to engender the spirit of camaraderie and hard work that we imagine those living and brewing in this neighborhood at that time embodied.

We self distribute our beer, which means each beer that you drink in a bar or restaurant is poured from a keg that we delivered cold in our refrigerated van (keep your eyes peeled for it around town). We like to keep beer as fresh as possible, which means that every keg we fill is immediately moved into cold storage where it sits until we load it onto our refrigerated van for delivery to the coldbox of each local account. Fresh beer is tasty beer, and that’s our favorite kind.

data.name: Rat Bastard Pale Ale
data.description:
Rat Bastard Pale Ale was the first beer brewed here at Stumptown and a Blue Ribbon winner at the California State Fair. It really was a beer that named itself (although many of the regulars here will tell you it was named in their honor).

Rat Logo In an effort to get our first beer brewed and aged in time for the Santa Rosa Beer Festival (at the LBC) we found ourselves lacking a few key ingredients. They included grain and yeast. We borrowed some grain from Third Street Aleworks, some more from Bear Republic , and Brian at Moonlight Brewing was kind enough to lend us a couple of kegs to put it in.

Anyway, what is the Rat Bastard Pale Ale? Jay Brooks of the (Brookston Beer Bulletin) said "The Rat Bastard is a well-made pale ale, with good aromas and a crisp, clean palate. It has a generous hop bite that finishes bitter, then drops off sharply in the end."
The Rat is a very chuggable drop. Coming in at just under 6%, it's a fine session beer with a clean dry finish. With its balanced hop profile the Rat is crisp on the tongue and pleasant (slightly floral with some citrus) to the nose, without over powering it's malt character. 
Our favorite review "This tastes like beer".

data.name: Rat Pad - Local Option Pale
data.description:
An extra special pale ale that has been dry hopped with copious amounts of locally grown Chinook and Columbus hops from Hot Haus Hops and Summit hops from Hop Union. This deliciously hoppy and local endeavor is 5.6 ABV and 40 IBU.

Local amateur brewers create imaginative beers on our 10-gallon Rat Pad brew system. We release these brews on the third Wednesday of each month at 6 p.m. and serve them at the Microbrewery while supplies last. Supplies are limited so come early! Anything left after 9pm can be purchased to take home in a growler.

breweries.name: Bitter Ester's Brewhouse
breweries.description: We are a Small Artisan Nano-Brewery!  We specialize in English inspired American Ales and Belgian-style Farmhouse Ales.  We use only the finest barley, grown and malted all over the world.  We use hops that are grown all over the world as well.  If you are noticing a theme our beers are unique to each time we brew therefore we need to tap the expert farmers and craftsman worldwide to get these wonderful and unique ingredients.  We have six ales on draft at any one time and our Dry stout and Brown Ale are the only reoccurring beers.  We brew farmhouse ales that are different every batch we brew.

data.name: Ray Ray's Pale Ale

This is an extremely drinkable un-filtered American-style pale ale.

breweries.name: Center of the Universe Brewing
breweries.description:
Center of the Universe Brewing Company (or COTU for short), will be opening on November 16th. COTU began back in 2009 when Chris Ray and his brother Phil began brewing beer in their houses. The hobby turned into an obsession, and the obsession has led them to open up a craft brewery in Ashland, Virginia. Located in the heart of Central Virginia, it is affectionately known as “The Center of the Universe”. COTU will be brewing an assortment of ales using only whole ingredients, while sticking to the traditional all-natural method of brewing beer.

The meaning of “Center of the Universe” is important to the founders of COTU. With so much emphasis today on globalization and the lack of corporate stewardship, COTU wanted to be a company that truly embraces the local community. “Center of the Universe,” to COTU, is taking pride in where you live and respecting the people with whom you interact. We believe it is our responsibility to understand and appreciate how our actions affect the community that supports us.

At Center of the Universe Brewing Company it all revolves around the beer and the people who enjoy it.

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Birra Toccalmatto
breweries.description: Beer Toccalmatto began producing Fidenza in October 2008 with a facility to be cooked to 550 Liters. This is the culmination of a dream of founder Bruno personnel Carillo, who after several managerial experience in the food and beer in particular, has the idea to start producing craft beer. The passion for beer lives of British and Belgian tradition from a project with three other friends, and the beginning of this new adventure.

data.name: Re-Mash
data.description:
In May 2011 the world’s largest collaborative brew was released. The intention was to create a New Zealand beer that drew from all of the influences that made the New Zealand craft beer scene what it is. The brewers that inspired the recipe were then offered a chance to brew this beer themselves, reimagining the recipe as they went. This beer is the result of a collaboration between Fraser and Hayden at Ad Lib, Ally at Golden Ticket and Nathan a local brewer.

This beer is lightly golden, and pours with a creamy white head. Fresh summer fruits with a marmalade mix float to the nose, accompanied by some light toffee sweetness. A fruit bowl will mix in your mouth, blending well with the light body, leaving you with palate cleansing bitterness. Best drunk in summer while tending to a BBQ or spinning a yarn with friends.

breweries.name: Ad Lib Brewing Company
breweries.description:
In 2011 a plan was hatched. Two flatmates Hayden and Fraser decided that they would start their own brewery. A month, and many beers later Ad Lib was born. The first beer UCom was made at the Twisted Hop, but due to the February earthquake this beer was never released.

The quake only reinforced Ad Libs' belief, that they should continue, and a new premise and new inspiration was found. The good blokes at Wigram brewery gave them a hand and the magic that is Ad Lib Brewing finally reached you!

breweries.name: Golden Ticket Brewing
breweries.description: Golden Ticket Brewing were Nathan Crabbe and Ally McGilvray. In the winter of 2009 they decided to enter the New Zealand brewing world with a desire to brew the best and most seasonally appropriate beers they could manage. Brewing with the team at Invercargill Brewery their debut beer is expected in New Zealands best bars and pubs in the Spring of 2009. After Nathan moved on to new pastures Ally decided to keep the dream alive and continued brewing as Golden Ticket Brewing.

data.name: ReAle
data.description: Inspired by traditional India Pale Ales, best known for their generous hopping, ReAle is customized with American aroma hops. In the glass it's amber, the predominating notes are citrusy (grapefruit and oranges) and peppery. The carbonation is low, keeping the beer true to its style, the body is medium with a long finish. Has an intense and persisting bitter ending.

data.name: ReAle 8th Anniversario
data.description: A celebrative version of our Classic ReAle; we brew it every year for the brewery's birthday. Every year a different recipe (yet on the same style), different hops, different brewing tecniques. Every year we try to surprise the ones who love our most famous beer and its hoppy carachter: it is a “variations on a theme” where we paly with our fantasy and your tastebuds, to celebrate with style. Happy birthday BdB!

breweries.name: Beer Army Combat Brewery
breweries.description: The Beer Army Combat Brewery is a micro brewery located in Trenton, North Carolina. The brewery opened on April 19th, 2013 in the small town of 287 people.  The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.

data.name: Rebirth Pale Ale
data.description: A beautiful Pale Ale made in partnership with The Roots of Music Foundation.  This American Pale Ale has a medium-light body and a blend of Citra, Cascade, and Simcoe hops to give it a blast of citrus notes on the nose and palate.  A portion of the proceeds for Rebirth Pale Ale go to The Roots of Music Foundation to help provide instruments and music lessons to the children of New Orleans. Available in 12oz. cans and on Draft.

breweries.name: Mad Anthony Brewing
breweries.description: Looking for the best beer in town? Look no further my friend, Mad Anthony’s Brewery has got you covered. Grab a pint of our award-winning hand-crafted ales or lagers and kick back in one of our three locations. A cool, laid back atmosphere, full food menu, weekly live music, and of course an ever-changing menu of awesome beer is always in full swing. We offer one of the area’s best deep dish Chicago style pizzas, a variety of vegetarian selections, our now famous "Unwraps" and traditional pub fare. Whether you want something light, or are ready for a full meal, or need catering services for your next gathering, let us show you why Mad Anthony’s Brewery should be at the top of your list for fun!

breweries.name: Lazy Magnolia Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in September of 2003, Lazy Magnolia is Mississippi's first brewery offering locally brewed beer to Mississippians and visitors to our state at all of their favorite restaurants. Located in the Bootleg capital of Mississippi, we break with tradition by offering legal brew to our customers!

Lazy Magnolia is dedicated to providing the best possible products through our tireless efforts, our superior motivation, and our Southern heritage. We offer our customers a line of refreshing beverages, made in true Southern Style, complementing the traditions of the South and remaining true to Southern tastes.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Every Saturday at 10:30am. No reservation required.  After the tour, we'll give you a list of great local places to try our beer! No beer samples at the brewery. It's the law, in Mississippi anyway.

data.name: Red Brick Pale Ale
data.description:
A classic American-style Pale Ale, with medium body and a slight caramel sweetness. Medium hop bitterness is perfectly balanced by the citrus like flavor and aroma of the Cascades and Crystal hops.

This lovely, amber colored beer is natural for pairing with spicy foods.

breweries.name: Red Brick Brewing Company
breweries.description:
As the southeast's oldest brewery, Red Brick recently celebrated their 20th Anniversary. This milestone not only exemplifies their continuing commitment to amazing craft beer, but also signals a shift in focus for the brewery towards more innovative recipes and concepts.

Headed up by a small group of impassioned beer lovers including head brewer Garett Lockhart, Red Brick is determined to lead the charge in the south, putting out excellent beers such as "Hoplanta" IPA and the upcoming winter release "Sacred Cow" chai milk stout. They also take time to push the limits of brewing with the "Brick Mason" series, which the staff sees as their continuing masterpiece. Highlights from this series include "The Lost Years" old ale, "Black-Eye Rye" American black ale, and the most recent release "20th Anniversary", a 10% Imperial stout that was aged in Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels. Early accolades have already compared it to the hallowed KBS.

The future keeps looking brighter and brighter for this brewery, and the next couple years will see them growing and experimenting with diverse styles, collaborating with fellow breweries, implementing a new barrel program, and continuing to raise the bar for themselves in all aspects. After all, craft beer isn't just a product; it's a journey.

data.name: Red Dog Rye
data.description: Everyone has to have a brew dog right? This was rightfully named after our four-legged friend, Cody. With a balanced blend of whole kernel and flaked rye malt, this beer has a crisp finish with hoppy flavor and an orange hue. In fact I really  can’t blame Cody for always wanting to lick it off the ground during a brew session.

breweries.name: Mother Earth Brew Company
breweries.description:
In early 2010, Mother Earth launched a unique brewing supply store and tasting room at its new Vista, CA location. Just a half mile from the 78 freeway and just minutes from the I-5, Mother Earth Brew Co. is right in the middle of the "North County Beer Triangle" in North San Diego County. 

Our business caters to home brewers seeking the highest quality, freshest ingredients and to people who enjoy sampling great beers - many of which are exclusively available at our tasting bar! Come on by for a truly unique experience, and always remember...Love Your Mother!
